title: Prepare for releasing v0.9.5
body:
Prepare for releasing v0.9.5.

Signed-off-by: Jiang Liu <gerry@linux.alibaba.com>

title: Update dependency to latest versions
body: Update dependency to latest versions

title: Introduce the common module.
body:
Major changes include.
* move some utilities from `transport` module to `common` module.
* temporarily include tokio-uring into `common` module.
* introdude wrapper for async File and async Runtime.
* remove `pub use file_trait` in transport module.

The tokio-uring is based on https://github.com/tokio-rs/tokio-uring/commit/6cacd95ee28c0d9bb5ce19aca4145788f988bbb8

with three more PRs applied:
https://github.com/tokio-rs/tokio-uring/pull/87
https://github.com/tokio-rs/tokio-uring/pull/88
https://github.com/tokio-rs/tokio-uring/pull/89  got merged now:)

title: upgrade vm-memory to 0.8.0
body:
solve the issue: https://github.com/openanolis/dragonball-sandbox/issues/166
Signed-off-by: uran0sH <huangwenyuu@outlook.com>

title: Second try to enable rust async io and io uring
body: Try again to enable rust async io and io uring by using tokio-uring.

title: macos: get rid of dependency on the diskarbitration-sys crate
body:
The diskarbitration-sys crate is out of maintenance, and locks the
core-foundataion-sys crate to an very old version. So avoid dependency
on it.

Signed-off-by: Jiang Liu <gerry@linux.alibaba.com>

title: fusedev: Fixed some issues about EINTR and EAGIN handled incorrectly
body:
1. Fixed an issue where epoll exited because EINTR was not processed
2. Fix the issue that EAGIN handled incorrectly

ref: https://github.com/libfuse/libfuse/blob/master/lib/fuse_lowlevel.c#L2807
ref: https://github.com/google/crosvm/blob/4c0de58cbf94291568906a479e91ed075bd91470/base/src/sys/unix/poll.rs#L214

Signed-off-by: zyfjeff <zyfjeff@linux.alibaba.com>

title: passthrough: hornor no_open in do_getattr()
body:
Otherwise we'll get EBADF failure as we can't find handle in handle map.

Fixes: 2895435c15e7 ("passthrough: optimize async_do_getattr/do_getattr()")
Signed-off-by: Eryu Guan <eguan@linux.alibaba.com>

title: upgrade nix to 0.23.1
body:
This is to fix the warning of `cargo deny check bans`.
Sync to the version of image-service.

```
warning[B004]: found 3 duplicate entries for crate 'nix'
   ┌─ ./dragonball-sandbox/Cargo.lock:87:1
   │
87 │ ╭ nix 0.15.0 registry+https://github.com/rust-lang/crates.io-index
88 │ │ nix 0.22.3 registry+https://github.com/rust-lang/crates.io-index
89 │ │ nix 0.23.1 registry+https://github.com/rust-lang/crates.io-index
   │ ╰────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────^ lock entries
   │
   = nix v0.15.0
     ├── dbs-address-space v0.1.0
     └── dbs-virtio-devices v0.1.0
   = nix v0.22.3
     └── fuse-backend-rs v0.4.0
         ├── blobfs v0.1.0
         │   └── dbs-virtio-devices v0.1.0
         ├── dbs-virtio-devices v0.1.0 (*)
         ├── nydus-utils v0.1.0
         │   ├── rafs v0.1.0
         │   │   ├── blobfs v0.1.0 (*)
         │   │   └── dbs-virtio-devices v0.1.0 (*)
         │   └── storage v0.5.0
         │       ├── blobfs v0.1.0 (*)
         │       └── rafs v0.1.0 (*)
         ├── rafs v0.1.0 (*)
         └── storage v0.5.0 (*)
   = nix v0.23.1
     ├── rafs v0.1.0
     │   ├── blobfs v0.1.0
     │   │   └── dbs-virtio-devices v0.1.0
     │   └── dbs-virtio-devices v0.1.0 (*)
     └── storage v0.5.0
         ├── blobfs v0.1.0 (*)
         └── rafs v0.1.0 (*)
```

Signed-off-by: wllenyj <wllenyj@linux.alibaba.com>

title: cargo: fix and enforce clippy
body:
Turns out that we missed clippy for a long time by passing a wrong
argument to clippy. Re-enable it and fix all the remaining failures.

title: syncio/asyncio: account for FUSE buffer header in length check
body:
Actual maximum message size is MAX_BUFFER_SIZE plus the FUSE buffer
header size. Allow messages up to that size.

Signed-off-by: zhaoshang <zhaoshangsjtu@linux.alibaba.com>

title: fusedev: handle all events before returning
body:
Otherwise, we might end up missing the EXIT_FUSE_EVENT event because
the function returns when handling the FUSE_DEV_EVENT event.

title: virtiofs: Modify the `new` interface of Reader/Writer.
body:
In dragonball-sandbox's virtiofs device, when using Reader/Writer,
the specific type of GuestMemory is not known, so generic parameters
are needed here.

Signed-off-by: wllenyj <wllenyj@linux.alibaba.com>

title: transport: fix get_request in linux
body:
mio default add EPOLLET to event flags, so epoll will use
edge-triggered mode. It may let poll miss some event, so
manually register the fd with only EPOLLIN flag to
use level-triggered mode.

title: sync two minor commits
body:
* passthroughfs: export file handle and mount fd
* vfs: do not evict pseudofs inodes when unmount

title: action: run all tests in docker-smoke
body:
Turns out that we have ignored a few tests by default to make it work
when /dev/fuse is not available. But for docker-smoke, we should really
run them all.

Signed-off-by: Peng Tao <bergwolf@hyper.sh>

title: api: reply destory ok
body: macfuse kernel need the reply to exit.

title: transport: fix mac_session wake api signature
body: miss &self in params

title: Clippy fix
body: fix various clippy issues.

title: release: prepare for the 0.3.0 release
body:
Add a github action to help publish and release automatically when a new tag is pushed.

Tested here:
https://github.com/bergwolf/fuse-backend-rs/runs/5091078480?check_suite_focus=true
https://github.com/bergwolf/fuse-backend-rs/releases/tag/v1.4.0
https://crates.io/crates/my-test-app-bergwolf/1.4.0

title: actions: add cargo deny support
body: `advisories` found 3 RUSTSECs on `stderrlog` but there are no known fix to it. `stderrlog` needs to fix itself. These RUSTSECs are safely ignored because we only use `stderrlog` in UT.

title: allow file system to customize all supported FUSE feature
api: support more server APIs
body:
Let the underlying file system decide if they want to handle them.
Add ioctl, getlk, setlk, setlkw, bmap and poll support.

Note, for ioctl we return ENOTTY by default to simulate that the API is
actually implemented but no ioctl is supported. This is needed because
newer overlayfs would query underlying fs for some security features and
we cannot return ENOSYS otherwise the error is treated as fatal and
popped up to userspace.

Signed-off-by: Peng Tao <bergwolf@hyper.sh>

title: prepare for 0.2.0 release
body:
- add more checks on path names passed from fuse kernel module
- some minor bug fixes
- update vm-memory to 0.7.0
- add @eryugey to CODEOWNERS
- bump version to 0.2.0

title: virtiofs: update to use virtio-queue 0.1.0
body: So that we no longer rely on a non-release git commit.

title: fusedev: let caller decide if readonly mount is needed
filesystem: fix warnings in rust 1.56
body:
Got:
warning: this attribute can only be applied to a `use` item
  --> src/api/filesystem/mod.rs:25:7
   |
25 | #[doc(inline)]
   |       ^^^^^^ only applicable on `use` items
26 | mod async_io;
   | ------------- not a `use` item
   |
   = note: `#[warn(invalid_doc_attributes)]` on by default
   = warning: this was previously accepted by the compiler but is being phased out; it will become a hard error in a future release!
   = note: for more information, see issue #82730 <https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/82730>
   = note: read https://doc.rust-lang.org/nightly/rustdoc/the-doc-attribute.html#docno_inlinedocinline for more information

This commit would fix this problem.

Signed-off-by: Tim Zhang <tim@hyper.sh>

title: transport: enable virtiofs and vhost-user-fs
body:
Bring back virtiofs and vhost-user-fs support so that consumers can use
the latest code to run virtiofs and vhost-user-fs.

title: Introduce per file dax support and no_readdir config option
body:
- api: impl Default for Entry structure
- passthroughfs: support per-file DAX
- abi: add with_flags function to create linux_abi::Attr
- passthrough: don't flood log with unnecessary error logs
- passthrough: introduce no_readdir config

title: Various fixes and improvments
body:
- passthrough: add mnt id as inode alt key
- passthrough: enhance open_file_or_handle() and use it where possible
- passthroughfs: fix readdir to return correct inode number
- test: fix a clippy warning related to panic!()
- vfs: optimize get_fs_by_idx()

title: server: do not filter out the RENAME_WHITEOUT flag of rename2
body:
To use virtio-fs directories as the upperdir of overlayfs in VMs, we
need to passthrough the RENAME_WHITEOUT flag. The Linux kernel commit
519525fa47b5a8155f0b203e49a3a6a2319f75ae already enabled the passthrough
of the flag. Therefore, let's avoid filtering out it for rename2.

Signed-off-by: Jiachen Zhang <zhangjiachen.jaycee@bytedance.com>

title: Update dependency to latest version
body:
Update dependency to latest version:
1) use vhost from crates.io
2) use vmm-sys-util v0.8

title: Enhance passthrough to reduce active fds by using file handle
body:
1. Enhance passthrough to reduce active fds by using file handle
2. Upgrade to latest vm-memory v0.6
3. Enhance fuse-backend crate to support guest dirty page tracking.

title: Release v0.1.2
body: Signed-off-by: Liu Jiang <gerry@linux.alibaba.com>

title: Support killpriv_v2 and DAX window

1) enhance the Server to support KILLPRIV_v2

title: actions: run smoke test in docker
body: So that we indeed run a live fuse daemon to test.

title: vfs: disable ATOMIC_O_TRUNC when no_open is set
body:
When no_open is enabled, kernel doesn't send open request to fuse
server, so there's no chance for fuse server to handle O_TRUNC open
flag and truncate file to 0. This ends up in non-zero file after a
O_TRUNC open.

Fix it by disabling ATOMIC_O_TRUNC feature when no_open is set, so that
fuse will send setattr request to do the truncate.

Signed-off-by: Eryu Guan <eguan@linux.alibaba.com>

title: various fixes and improvements
body:
Changwei Ge (1):
      api: fix fuse init-msg response overflow

Eryu Guan (1):
      passthroughfs: don't overwrite existing inode with the same altkey

Liu Jiang (9):
      transport/fusedev: refine doc of session manager
      transport/fusedev: refine FuseChannel
      transport/fusedev: refactor FuseSession interfaces
      transport/fusedev: replace epoll with vmm_sys_util::Poll
      transport/fusedev: remove several unwrap()
      transport: simplify Writer::commit()
      async-io: move FuseDevTask to session.rs
      transport/fusedev: preallocate buffer for Writer
      transport: replace Writer::write_vector()

Peng Tao (3):
      clippy: fix unneeded return statements
      tests: fix test_new_channel
      tests: do not ignore smoke
